results.title: Sex role development (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines the male and female sex roles, focusing on how stereotypes are formed. Discusses ways to avoid transmitting these traditional stereotypes to children. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Moral development (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines two opposing theories of moral development, that of Lawrence Kohlberg who believes that there are stages of moral development tied to cognitive development, and that of the learning theorists who contend that moral behaviour like all behaviour is learned, and that reasons for actions are irrelevant. Using Dr Stanley Milgrim’s famous obedience experiment each of the six stages of moral reasoning is represented in this film, one at a time, by six different participants. The stages differ in the types of reasons a person gives for making a decision about a moral dilemma and in the type of concern the person shows for the self, society, and authority.

results.title: Language development (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Shows the most current research being done on language development, such as Dr David Premack’s work at the University of California teaching language to chimpanzees. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Infancy (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Howard Gardner, Jerome Kagan, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines behaviour and cognitive patterns characteristic of the first 18 months of life, including object permanence, stranger and separation anxiety, reaction to discrepancy and maturing co-ordinations. Discusses individual differences in infant temperament.

results.title: Cognitive development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordan and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: Language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Harper & Row and State Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines the child’s language process in the first four years, beginning with the development of phonemes, semantics and syntax. Looks at the process by which language is acquired and how that acquisition can be influenced.

results.title: Cognition (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Richard L. Berman, Bay State Film Productions and Harper & Row
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
Examines developmental changes in perception, memory, evaluation and reasoning. Includes Piaget’s description of the major stages of development and intelligence and discusses the relevance of attention to detail, recognition and recall memory, conservation of mass and number, and reasoning evaluation.

results.title: Cross cultural approach to acquisition of sex roles and social standards (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, Bay State Film Productions, Harper & Row and Jerome Kagan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Development of the Child”.
The culturally diverse settings of Guatemala, Kenya and Japan focus on the basic mechanisms by which social standards and sex role orientations are acquired. Children are shown learning by the mechanisms of observation, imitation, praise and punishment.
